Motion

Experiments with FramerJS

I recently started playing around with Framer.js, a JS framework to build high-definition mobile prototypes.

Framer uses CoffeeScript, which is easier on the eyes than vanilla JS, but still got quite the learning curve — you still have to know what you’re doing to pull out the crazy stuff.

Regardless, it’s really fun to play with. This is what I came up with so far.

Pulse

A pulsing circle — a test to get used to the basic features of Framer

See the code on GitHub

iOS Notification

A small prototype that simulates an iOS Notification. Notification sound was supposed to be working

See the code on GitHub

Also, see below some resources to get started with Framer:

CoffeeScript for FramerJS

A small book to introduce designers to CoffeeScript focused on prototyping with Framer.

Creating your first prototype with Framer

A great small tutorial to make your first Framer prototyping using assets exported from Sketch.

Framer Basics

The official resource to get the basics of Framer. Make sure to read the advanced documentation and take a look at the examples as well!

Framer Facebook Group

Official Facebook group for Framer discussion. Really active and the development team is always around to answer questions and get feedback from the community.

Framer Slack Chat

If Slack’s your thing, here you go. It’s not as active as the official Facebook group, but there’s a ton of people.

The Little Book on CoffeeScript

The O’Reilly book for CoffeeScript. Free to read online!
